customLinks.query:
let end = datetime({monitor.DataEndTime});
let start = datetime({monitor.DataStartTime});
JobErrors
| where TIMESTAMP between (start .. end) and SourceNamespace == "{monitor.Dimension.SourceNamespace}" and operationName == "{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}"
| extend accountName = extract(@"storage account '(\w+)'", 1, message) 
| extend businessGroup = extract(@"replication group '(\w+)'", 1, message) 
| project TIMESTAMP, businessGroup, accountName, operationName, SourceNamespace
| summarize count() by SourceNamespace, operationName, businessGroup, accountName| order by count_ desc
customLinks.title: Errors by Business Group and Account Names, if available

monitors.customMessage: If you get this alert, please check the health classichydration* storage accounts. There could be two situations the alert fires: 1. RDFE is having an outage that we cannot get the hydration storage account keys from it; 2. We migrated the hydration storage accounts to non-RDFE managed type, hence we are not able to get the keys from RDFE. For 1, correlate with other alerts you received at the time (like SHIM providers alerts) to determine if it's an RDFE outage and escalate accordingly. For 2, check from ACIS and see if you can get the storage account from AzureRT --> Subscription Management --> Get subscription with details. If not, escalate to XStore\XLocation Service to convert the storage account back to Classic type.

monitors.customMessage: This monitor checks that the error rate for individual operations does not exceed a pre-defined threshold for an extended period of time (at least 15 minutes within the last 30 minutes, using 1 minute buckets). If it fires, it may indicate that there is a persistent issue running a specific internal operation and that will likely cause impact to customer flows.
monitors.customTitle: ARM [{monitor.Dimension.__Role}] in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] is experiencing a high failure rate for the [{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}] operation which may be impacting customer workflows.
monitors.description:
bpannell (2020/07/15): Refactored monitor to simplify the dimension space, improve alert correlation and improve readability of incident titles in accordance with https://aka.ms/arm-monitoring-design.
nst (2020/06/24): Added FrontdoorJobCallback.OnExecutionResult to exclusion list while investigating: https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/193798291/home
Tian (2020/06/23): Removed FrontdoorJobCallback.OnExecutionResult from exclusion list. Policy team confirmed the fix was deployed. 
Tian (2020/06/23): Added BatchRequestProcessingEngine.ProcessBatchResourceRequest to exclusion list. Work item here: https://msazure.visualstudio.com/One/_backlogs/backlog/Azure-ARM-Core/Epics/?workitem=7524139
Stivanov (2020/06/19): Adding FrontdooJobCallback.OnExecutionResult to the exclusion list. The policy fix hasn't gone in the ROW
Tian (2020/06/19): Removed ResourceDeletionJob.OnExecuteJob and FrontdoorJobCallback.OnExecutionResult from exclusion list
Tian: excluded "ResourceDeletionJob.OnExecuteJob" for uk decommissioning. one incident: https://icm.ad.msft.net/imp/v3/incidents/details/190416404/home
Tian: excluded "FrontdoorJobCallback.OnExecutionResult" for known issues in Policy and UK North/South2. One incident is: https://icm.ad.msft.net/imp/v3/incidents/details/190164686/home
Yushus: excluded RX tenant

Ian: Added  SourceNameSpace: {monitor.Dimension.SourceNameSpace} to the ICM Message - this is need for Geneva Automation
Ian Added exclusion for SequencerJob.TryExecuteSequencerActionCallback until issue with this is fixed on advise from Nick

Maphad: Temporarily added ResourceProviderLinkedNotificationJob.OnJobExecute to exclusion list. https://icm.ad.msft.net/imp/v3/incidents/details/135208623/home 

Maphad: Exclude SubscriptionConsistencyJob errors as they are firing due to stopping subscription writes to storage

ilahat: temporarily excluding X509CertificateExtensions.Authorize -- UNDONE

nst (2019-12-25): Temporarily excluding GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS/RESOURCEGROUPS/PROVIDERS/MICROSOFT.COMPUTE/VIRTUALMACHINES/METRICDEFINITIONS (see https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/164238534/home).
Ian (2020-04-22): Modify Errors query to sample data set - so the query does not fail if the results are large
Ian (2020-04-23): Extending the mitigated lookback time

conditions: UAE Central,UAE North,South Africa North,South Africa West,USNat East,USNat West
monitors.customTitle: StorageOperations Alert: High critical error rate for operation [{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}] in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] in 240M

monitors.customTitle: Frontdoor Worker Alert: High error rate for operation [{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}] in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] in 30M

customLinks.query:
let end = datetime({monitor.DataEndTime});
let start = datetime_add('minute', -30, (datetime({monitor.DataStartTime})));
JobErrors
| where TIMESTAMP between (start .. end) and SourceNamespace == "{monitor.Dimension.SourceNamespace}" and operationName == "{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}"
| extend accountName = extract(@"storage account '(\w+)'", 1, message) 
| extend businessGroup = extract(@"replication group '(\w+)'", 1, message) 
| project TIMESTAMP, businessGroup, accountName, operationName, SourceNamespace
| summarize count() by SourceNamespace, operationName, businessGroup, accountName| order by count_ desc
customLinks.title: Errors by Business Group and Account Names, if available

monitors.customTitle: StorageOperations Alert: High error rate for operation [{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}] in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] in 30M

metadata.metadataValue: All CAS Errors in that period All CAS Errors in that period https://armprod.kusto.windows.net:443/ARMProd?query=H4sIAAAAAAAEAI2QQUvDQBCF74L%2f4ZFTAiHgxVuEWCoUrJS24HmyOzSLyU6Z3a00%2bONNldoiHry%2bx7x535uriobbmw%2b8d6yM7WI532yb5QoPNWgn%2bX1X4GLLnpWiE%2f9CA6Oukc1oT8bF44xMxyuVg7Os1SKc9eZArqe25wyi%2f75%2fFrKPye44rlPPIbuqsJae4Tzy7EnFRyuiVWMH5yulcZz%2blLhyXkXfprw%2fLW7P%2bjdiSMNA6kaGkeRjXqA9onU%2b%2fxmlxF1XlNhIUsMnhDCV5%2fIX1leY6MRxCrgsajkYfAK8aSNXcQEAAA%3d%3d&web=0  Errors | where TIMESTAMP >= ago(6h)  | where operationName == "CapacityCacheProvider.IsCapacityAvailable" or operationName == "CapacityCacheProvider.LoadBudgetRules"  | where Role in ("Frontdoor.Admin.razzle", "Frontdoor.Worker.razzle", "Frontdoor.Web.razzle")  | summarize count() by bin(TIMESTAMP, 1h), SourceNamespace, operationName   | order by TIMESTAMP desc

monitors.description:
Yushus: Exclude RX metrics
Ian:Reformated IcM Incident Metadata - links for queries to Kusto and Jarvis
maphad: Exclude COSMOSDB auth error - create a separate alert for that.

conditions: UAE Central,UAE North,South Africa North,South Africa West,USNat East,USNat West
monitors.customMessage: Critical Error means Role is recycling. Check if multiple regions are having this issue, if so any ongoing deployments to these regions should be stopped.
monitors.customTitle: StorageOperations Alert: High critical error rate for operation [{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}] in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] in 240M
monitors.description:
Yushus: excluded RX tenant
Monitor to replace StorageOperations_CriticalError_240M.
Removed SouthAfrica from exclusion since region is now GA
Frequency reduced to 10minutes/80minutes lookback
Added message for the monitor to help the oncall and do the right thing - added more details to the ICM message. 
Edited the Kusto and Jarvis Error Links to have only Errors and JobErrors links.

-Excluded South Africa West and South Africa North
